channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Republicans Undercut Johnson, Circumventing Him to Force Votes
item.description: The speaker has repeatedly lost his grip on the House floor thanks to a once rare parliamentary maneuver that G.O.P. members are increasingly using to...

item.title: AI data center boom sparks fears of glut amid lending frenzy
item.description: “Momentum is strong, but if this is irrational exuberance, investors will lose when the music stops,” said Squared Capital's Sadek Wahba.

item.title: Harold Hamm, Oklahoma Oil Tycoon, Allies With Trump to Reshape U.S. Energy
item.description: Harold Hamm, an Oklahoma oil tycoon, has played a central role in reshaping energy policy by allying himself with President Trump.

item.title: 40% of Stanford undergrads receive disability accommodations—but it’s become a college-wide phenomenon as Gen Z try to succeed in the current climate

item.title: A Seized Oil Tanker and the Big Business of Dark Fleet Smuggling

item.title: Republicans Defy Trump in Indiana, and Hundreds Quarantined in Measles Outbreak
Hinge CEO says he bribed students with KitKats to get the $550 million-a-year business off the ground: ‘I had to beg and borrow a lot’
item.description: "I was talking to as many people as I could and taking money from anyone who would give it to me," Hinge CEO Justin McLeod told Fortune.

item.title: Indiana Senate Republicans Reject Trump’s Redistricting Effort
item.description: Republicans hold an overwhelming majority in the Indiana Senate, but more than a dozen of them defied the president’s wishes, voting against a map aim...

item.title: Black Lives Matter leader in Oklahoma City indicted on claims she used funds for vacations, groceries and real estate
item.description: Tashella Sheri Amore Dickerson, 52, was indicted earlier this month on 20 counts of wire fraud and five counts of money laundering, court records show...

item.title: AI is powering Trump’s economy, but American voters are getting worried
item.description: In both political parties there’s a sense that more thought-out AI strategies will be needed. One Trump adviser calls AI a “political football.”

item.title: Dozens Killed as a Hospital Is Bombed in Myanmar’s Brutal Civil War
item.description: Jets from the Myanmar military dropped two bombs on the facility in Mrauk-U, in what rebels and witnesses called a deliberate attack on civilians.

item.title: For 2 Hours, a Soccer Match Offers Palestinians a Rarity: Joy

item.title: Russia Sues Holder of Frozen Assets Europe Wants for Ukraine Loan
item.description: The lawsuit was a warning to European officials who are racing to agree to a plan to use Russian government assets in Europe to lend money to Ukraine.
